response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Array Median\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers, write a function `array_median` that calculates the median of the array. The median is the middle value in an array when it's sorted.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef array_median(arr: list[int]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the median of the input array.\\n\", \"code\": \"def array_median(arr: list[int]) -> int:\\n    arr.sort()\\n    n = len(arr)\\n    if n % 2 == 0:\\n        mid1 = arr[n // 2 - 1]\\n        mid2 = arr[n // 2]\\n        return (mid1 + mid2) // 2\\n    else:\\n        return arr[n // 2]\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert array_median([1, 3, 5]) == 3\", \"assert array_median([1, 2, 3, 4]) == 2.5\", \"assert array_median([0, 0, 0]) == 0\", \"assert array_median([-10, -5, 0, 5]) == 0\"] }"
